original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka bonds plunged around 400 basis points Thursday after Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said re-structuring will be voluntary, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 traded at 25.00 percnet Thursday from the last close of around 28.50/29.00 percent dealers said.
Related Sri Lanka will not restructure T-bills outside Central Bank, bonds voluntary: Governor
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 also dropped to around 25 percent, from 28.25/50 percent amid active trading, dealer said.
Sri Lanka’s interest rates have been elevated despite falling domestic credit, due to fears of debt re-structuring which is a type of default.
Sri Lanka Treasury bill yeilds also fell at the last auction. (Colombo/Apr06/2023)
